title: What are the differences between OLED and QLED Televisions? Which one has better picture quality? - Quora

response.answer_text: QLED is a very broad term for mini-LED displays, quantum dot layer simply converts the blue mini-LED’s behind the LCD into RGB, this turns into vastly superior IPS panels with pretty perfect blacks, in fact this is the ultimate LCD display that for some reason only comes to production in 2019–2020 as opposed to 10 years ago. Picture quality of OLED is better, since it’s emissive technology, but it will only be better for a short time before the burn-in will slowly destroy the image, and before the organic pixels lose their color and become washed out. OLED is also super dim and unsuitable for bright rooms. OLED TV technology is not the same as OLED in your phone, it’s much worse, it’s fundamentally different only sharing the organic pixel chemistry, because it’s impossible to make OLED panels that are in your phone bigger than ~5″ in size. OLED TV’s also have PWM flicker at low brightness when you’re watching TV at night, this leads to feeling of sand in your eyes, and other cases migraines. So the best TV you can get today is QLED/Mini-LED (they are the same thing) a miniLED display must have the quantum dot film otherwise the picture will be blue instead of RGB. These TV’s will easily have 240Hz refresh rates, will have HDR, will not burn-in and die like OLED. OLED is too disposable and with normal TV cycle being 10 years or so, OLED simply won’t last that long.

Q. Between OLED and QLED, which one has a better image? Which one is better for gaming like frame rate and refresh rate? A. I can’t speak specifically for gaming. I am not a gamer and no one in our home uses a TV for gaming. As far as the first part is concerned - which TV has better image quality - I think OLED is superior on all respect accept for brightness.
